unnormalised: Okay, here's the generated Quora post, designed to be unnormalized training data for a normalization model, as per your instructions:
normalised: Visiting Vaishno Devi was quite the experience! I planned the trip for twenty sixth October last year to twenty ninth October last year with my family. Booked the train tickets months in advance; Jammu Tawi Express. Reached Jammu around six A M on the twenty seventh. From there, took a pre-paid taxi (rupee eight hundred) to Katra. Trust me, prepone your bookings if you are travelling during peak season; it gets insanely crowded.

unnormalised: Visiting Vaishno Devi was quite the experience! I planned the trip for Oct 26th - Oct 29th last year with my family. Booked the train tickets months in advance; Jammu Tawi Express. Reached Jammu around 6:00 AM on the 27th. From there, took a pre-paid taxi (₹800) to Katra. Trust me, prepone your bookings if you're travelling during peak season; it gets insanely crowded.
normalised: The trek itself is about twelve kilometer, and I opted for a helicopter ride for my parents as they are both above sixty years. The chopper ride cost us around rupees three thousand five hundred per person. After reaching Bhawan, had a quick darshan. The waiting time was roughly three hours, even with the priority pass. Remember to carry warm clothes, especially if you are travelling anytime around December to January; it gets chilly! Post darshan, we had some prasad and started our descent.

unnormalised: The trek itself is about 12 km, and I opted for a helicopter ride for my parents as they're both above 60 yrs. The chopper ride cost us around Rs. 3500 per person. After reaching Bhawan, had a quick darshan. The waiting time was roughly 3 hrs, even with the priority pass. Remember to carry warm clothes, esp. if you're travelling anytime around Dec-Jan; it gets chilly! Post darshan, we had some prasad and started our descent.
normalised: We hired a pithu (porter) for my mother; cost rupees five hundred. Reached Katra late at night, around eleven P M. Next morning, we visited the local market, did some shopping (got some nice shawls for around rupee one thousand each), and then headed back to Jammu to catch our train back to Delhi.

unnormalised: We hired a pithu (porter) for my mother; cost Rs. 500. Reached Katra late at night, around 11 PM. Next morning, we visited the local market, did some shopping (got some nice shawls for around ₹1000 each), and then headed back to Jammu to catch our train back to Delhi.
normalised: Overall, it was a fulfilling trip. One tip: Register online at the official website before your visit. It will save you a lot of time. Jai Mata Di!

unnormalised: Overall, it was a fulfilling trip. One tip: Register online at the official website before your visit. It will save you a lot of time. Jai Mata Di!
